who sings you're welcome in moana credits

Reasoning process:

Answer:
Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson sings "You're Welcome" in the Moana credits.

anchoring.content:
You are a cognitive scientist, to answer the following question:
who sings you're welcome in moana credits
I will provide you with several retrieved passages:
Passages:
['BULLET::::- "You\'re Welcome" - "Moana"\n', 'BULLET::::- The song "You\'re Welcome" from the 2016 Walt Disney Pictures film "Moana" references "Sina and the Eel", but with the Polynesian demigod Maui having killed an eel and buried its guts in the ground to grow coconut trees. While singing the song to Moana, Maui plays with a coconut that has three round marks on its surface.\n', 'Towards the end of 2016, Illmind produced the outro credits for Disney\'s "Moana", a track titled "You\'re Welcome", Ft. both Lin-Manuel Miranda & Jordan Fisher\n', 'Lin-Manuel Miranda and Jordan Fisher sing a duet on "You\'re Welcome", which plays over the end credits. The song as performed by Dwayne Johnson appears in the film. Johnson\'s version of "You\'re Welcome" peaked at number 83 on the "Billboard" Hot 100 for the week of December 17, 2016. The soundtrack also features Jemaine Clement, who voices the coconut crab Tamatoa.\n', '"You\'re Welcome" is a song written by Brian Wilson for American rock band the Beach Boys. It was released on July 24, 1967 as the B-side of the "Heroes and Villains" single. It later appeared as a bonus track on the compilations "Smiley Smile/Wild Honey" (1990) and "The Smile Sessions" (2011).\n', "Carolan's Welcome is a traditional air composed by the Irish harper/songwriter Turlough O'Carolan, (1670-1738). In Donal O'Sullivan's exhaustive book covering Carolan and all his songs, this piece is listed as the first of ten Carolan songs that do not have surviving titles. There it is identified only as number 171 in the Carolan repertoire. Nothing whatsoever is known about the origin of the tune (except that it is by Carolan), and no lyrics have been attributed to it.\n", '"You\'re Welcome to Tonight" is a song written by Jim Hurt, Larry Henley and Grant Boatwright, and recorded by American country music artists Lynn Anderson and Gary Morris. It was released in December 1983 as the third single from Anderson\'s album "Back". The song reached number 9 on the "Billboard" Hot Country Singles & Tracks chart.\n', 'The title "Carolan\'s Welcome" was given to this piece relatively recently, by The Chieftains, who adapted it as theme music on the occasion of Pope John Paul II\'s historic visit to Dublin in 1979. The title has been used universally since then, occasionally with variations or misspellings, such as "Carden\'s Welcome", "O\'Carolan\'s Welcome", and "Carolan\'s Air". The song has been recorded by many artists, including Patrick Ball, David Wilcox (Canada), Lunasa, Mooncoin, and the Chieftains.\n', "You're Welcome (song)\n", 'In March 1988, she was chosen by Sara Dallin and Keren Woodward (who had known O\'Sullivan since they were eighteen) to become a member of Bananarama, as a replacement for outgoing member Siobhan Fahey, who also approved of the choice. Bananarama\'s hit streak continued with the addition of O\'Sullivan. They re-recorded the vocals for the songs "I Want You Back" and "Nathan Jones" with O\'Sullivan to replace versions previously recorded by Fahey. The group scored eight consecutive Top 40 hits in the UK with O\'Sullivan.\n']

To accurately answer the question about who sings "You're Welcome" in the credits of "Moana," we must consider the various performances of the song and the context in which they occur.

1. **Performance Details**:
   - The song "You're Welcome" is performed by **Dwayne Johnson** as the character **Maui** in the film itself. This version showcases Maui's playful and boastful personality and is integral to the film's narrative.

In the credits of "Moana," "You're Welcome" is sung by Lin-Manuel Miranda and Jordan Fisher. In the film itself, the song is performed by Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson as the character Maui.

This process aims to ensure that statements or claims are based on reliable and verifiable information while eliminating inaccurate or misleading content.

In the context of artificial intelligence, model illusion refers to the overconfidence response of the AI. 
When a model exhibits an 'illusion' (a tendency to output deceptive data), it indicates that the training data used by the model does not necessarily support the rationality of its outputs.

While singing the song to Moana, Maui plays with a coconut that has three round marks on its surface.\n', 'Towards the end of 2016, Illmind produced the outro credits for Disney\'s "Moana", a track titled "You\'re Welcome", Ft. both Lin-Manuel Miranda & Jordan Fisher\n', 'Lin-Manuel Miranda and Jordan Fisher sing a duet on "You\'re Welcome", which plays over the end credits. The song as performed by Dwayne Johnson appears in the film. Johnson\'s version of "You\'re Welcome" peaked at number 83 on the "Billboard" Hot 100 for the week of December 17, 2016. The soundtrack also features Jemaine Clement, who voices the coconut crab Tamatoa.\n', '"You\'re Welcome" is a song written by Brian Wilson for American rock band the Beach Boys. It was released on July 24, 1967 as the B-side of the "Heroes and Villains" single. It later appeared as a bonus track on the compilations "Smiley Smile/Wild Honey" (1990) and "The Smile Sessions" (2011).\n', "Carolan's Welcome is a traditional air composed by the Irish harper/songwriter Turlough O'Carolan, (1670-1738). In Donal O'Sullivan's exhaustive book covering Carolan and all his songs, this piece is listed as the first of ten Carolan songs that do not have surviving titles. There it is identified only as number 171 in the Carolan repertoire. Nothing whatsoever is known about the origin of the tune (except that it is by Carolan), and no lyrics have been attributed to it.\n", '"You\'re Welcome to Tonight" is a song written by Jim Hurt, Larry Henley and Grant Boatwright, and recorded by American country music artists Lynn Anderson and Gary Morris. It was released in December 1983 as the third single from Anderson\'s album "Back". The song reached number 9 on the "Billboard" Hot Country Singles & Tracks chart.\n', 'The title "Carolan\'s Welcome" was given to this piece relatively recently, by The Chieftains, who adapted it as theme music on the occasion of Pope John Paul II\'s historic visit to Dublin in 1979. The group scored eight consecutive Top 40 hits in the UK with O\'Sullivan.\n']

**Knowledge Enhanced Inference Process:**

In the animated film "Moana," the song "You're Welcome" is performed by the character Maui, who is voiced by Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson. This version of the song is featured prominently in the film. However, it is important to note that the version of "You're Welcome" that plays during the end credits is performed by Lin-Manuel Miranda and Jordan Fisher. This distinction is crucial, as it highlights that while Dwayne Johnson's performance is significant within the film, the credits feature a different rendition.

Additionally, the song was written by Lin-Manuel Miranda, which is an important detail for attributing the work correctly. The song also references "Sina and the Eel," which adds context to its narrative significance within the film. Furthermore, Dwayne Johnson's version of "You're Welcome" peaked at number 83 on the Billboard Hot 100 for the week of December 17, 2016, providing additional context about its popularity.

By integrating this information, we can clarify the roles of the various performers and the songwriter, ensuring that the model's knowledge is accurate and comprehensive.

**Answer:**
In the end credits of "Moana," "You're Welcome" is performed by Lin-Manuel Miranda and Jordan Fisher. However, the version featured in the film is sung by Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson, who voices the character Maui. The song was written by Lin-Manuel Miranda and references "Sina and the Eel."

question_info.question: who sings you're welcome in moana credits
passages:
BULLET::::- "You're Welcome" - "Moana"
BULLET::::- The song "You're Welcome" from the 2016 Walt Disney Pictures film "Moana" references "Sina and the Eel", but with the Polynesian demigod Maui having killed an eel and buried its guts in the ground to grow coconut trees. While singing the song to Moana, Maui plays with a coconut that has three round marks on its surface.
Towards the end of 2016, Illmind produced the outro credits for Disney's "Moana", a track titled "You're Welcome", Ft. both Lin-Manuel Miranda & Jordan Fisher
Lin-Manuel Miranda and Jordan Fisher sing a duet on "You're Welcome", which plays over the end credits. The song as performed by Dwayne Johnson appears in the film. Johnson's version of "You're Welcome" peaked at number 83 on the "Billboard" Hot 100 for the week of December 17, 2016. The soundtrack also features Jemaine Clement, who voices the coconut crab Tamatoa.
"You're Welcome" is a song written by Brian Wilson for American rock band the Beach Boys. It was released on July 24, 1967 as the B-side of the "Heroes and Villains" single. It later appeared as a bonus track on the compilations "Smiley Smile/Wild Honey" (1990) and "The Smile Sessions" (2011).
Carolan's Welcome is a traditional air composed by the Irish harper/songwriter Turlough O'Carolan, (1670-1738). In Donal O'Sullivan's exhaustive book covering Carolan and all his songs, this piece is listed as the first of ten Carolan songs that do not have surviving titles. There it is identified only as number 171 in the Carolan repertoire. Nothing whatsoever is known about the origin of the tune (except that it is by Carolan), and no lyrics have been attributed to it.
"You're Welcome to Tonight" is a song written by Jim Hurt, Larry Henley and Grant Boatwright, and recorded by American country music artists Lynn Anderson and Gary Morris. It was released in December 1983 as the third single from Anderson's album "Back". The song reached number 9 on the "Billboard" Hot Country Singles & Tracks chart.
The title "Carolan's Welcome" was given to this piece relatively recently, by The Chieftains, who adapted it as theme music on the occasion of Pope John Paul II's historic visit to Dublin in 1979. The title has been used universally since then, occasionally with variations or misspellings, such as "Carden's Welcome", "O'Carolan's Welcome", and "Carolan's Air". The song has been recorded by many artists, including Patrick Ball, David Wilcox (Canada), Lunasa, Mooncoin, and the Chieftains.
You're Welcome (song)
In March 1988, she was chosen by Sara Dallin and Keren Woodward (who had known O'Sullivan since they were eighteen) to become a member of Bananarama, as a replacement for outgoing member Siobhan Fahey, who also approved of the choice. Bananarama's hit streak continued with the addition of O'Sullivan. They re-recorded the vocals for the songs "I Want You Back" and "Nathan Jones" with O'Sullivan to replace versions previously recorded by Fahey. The group scored eight consecutive Top 40 hits in the UK with O'Sullivan.
